intro: Cheiranthus cornutus, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures. The plant produces striking, bright red or orange flowers with a distinctive horn-like appendage on the petals. It typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and coastal areas. Cheiranthus cornutus is a perennial herb that blooms from spring to early summer.
